page.title: 16Expressions in Part of Wigan
page.content:
Pupils in Class 7 at St. Jude's School in Worsley Mesnes quote some of the things their families say.
"I'll go to t'foot of our stairs" (when Dad doesn't believe something) "A butty dipped in t'kettle" (when I ask what is for tea) "A bucket full o'sand" (when I ask what I can play with) "Go and play with Jones's kids" (when I get in my mum's way) "Don't just wink at t'tap" (when I go upstairs for a wash) "Go and play marbles on the M6" (when I tell my brother I'm bored) "About two inches" (if I ask how long the chips will be) "Up the dancers" (when it's bedtime) "Go upstairs and kiss your daughter" (when I ask for a drink of water)
